title: schemaPersonalization
description: The personalization to apply, onto the code generated from the GraphQL schema

entityPersonalization.description: Each generated Entity can be personalized

name.description: The name of the entity to personalize

addAnnotation.description: This string will be added to the annotation(s) of this entity. You can put as many annotations as you want here, provided that they are properly separated. At least by a semi column. For proper format of the generated code, the best is to have a newline beween each annotation. If this entity already has annotation(s), a newline and indentation will be added first. Default value is null (no change to the annotations)

replaceAnnotation.description: This string will replace the annotations of this entity. If empty, the entity will no more be annotated. It's the way to remove the @Entity annotation for an object,if you wish. You can put as many annotations as you want here, provided that they are properly separated. At least by a semi column. For proper format of the generated code, the best is to have a newline then a tabulation beween each annotation. Default value is null (no change to the annotations)

newFields.description: The description of the fields that will be added to this entity, in the generated code

fieldPersonalizations.description: The changes that will be applied to the entity's fields, before the code generation

field.description: The description of a new field that will be added to the current entity, or of changes to apply on field existing in the GraphQL schema

name.description: The name of the new field

type.description: The name of the type of this new field. This field must be provided for new fields. It's optional when personalizing fields'

id.description: true if this field is the id of the entity (or part of). Default value is: false

list.description: true if this field is a list. In this case, the type indicates the type of the items in the list. Default value is: false

mandatory.description: true if this field is mandatory. Default value is: false

addAnnotation.description: This string will be added to the annotations of this field. You can put as many annotations as you want here, provided that they are properly separated. At least by a semi column. For proper format of the generated code, the best is to have a newline then a tabulation beween each annotation. If this field already has annotation, a newline and indentation will be added first. Default value is: null (no change)

replaceAnnotation.description: This string will replace the annotations of this field. You can put as many annotations as you want here, provided that they are properly separated. At least by a semi column. For proper format of the generated code, the best is to have a newline then a tabulation beween each annotation. If empty, the field will no more be annotated. Default value is: null (no change)
